category: Sports Fair Committee Regulations/Article 26 (Classification of disciplinary agencies, etc.)
contents: Article 26 (Classification of disciplinary agencies, etc.) ① The Committee is the reconsideration body for disciplinary matters initially decided by the Category Committee or City/Provincial Committee and the disciplinary matters initially decided by the Committee, and makes the final decision on disciplinary action. Revised December 26, 2022. ② If the jurisdiction for a disciplinary case is unclear, the committee determines the disciplinary jurisdiction among the committee, event committee, or city/provincial committee. ③ The relevant organization determined to have disciplinary jurisdiction must convene and process a committee within 3 months from the date of request for disposition. If processing is not possible due to reasons such as the lack of a committee, the relevant reconsideration body (member sports organization, member city/provincial sports council) In this case, it must be reported immediately to the member city/provincial sports association (in the case of the sports association, city/provincial sports association, or city/county/district sports association). In this case, the relevant institution that received the report determines the reason and re-determines disciplinary jurisdiction. Newly established on December 20, 2019, January 24, 2022. ④ For disciplinary matters decided by the city/provincial sports committee, the city/provincial committee makes the final decision on disciplinary action as the reconsideration body. However, if a member sports organization requests disciplinary action pursuant to Article 28 (2) to a city/provincial sports organization and the city/provincial sports committee decides on disciplinary action, the sports committee becomes the reconsideration body and makes the final decision on disciplinary action. Newly established 2022. 12. 26.
